nodes.bodyText:
Could you add an else if where appropriate here?
Also, we try to avoid if(...) <stmt>; the codestyle is if(...) { <stmt>; }, {} is always used, to avoid mistakes.

There is no need for an else if.
Is it preferred to have code style changes with functionality changes, or would it make better sense to have that in separate commits / pull requests?
Would reformating the file using the intellij-code-style.xml be acceptable? Does that represent the accepted code style?

We have some problem with getting the intellij-code-style.xml to work properly. Sometimes it do not make the desired line breaks. Especially it tend to leve do this:
    AType a = service.foo(argumentShouldBeOnNextLine,
        nextArgument,
        andSoOn
    );

the correct way is:
    AType a = service.foo(
        argumentShouldBeOnNextLine,
        nextArgument,
        andSoOn
    );

I use it on blocks of code, and sometimes on entire files - but a look over and fix the problem above.
There are settings for this, and I spent a day to get it to work, but sadly it does not. I think the underlying problem is the precedence of the format rules and the order they are applied.
I am very sorry this does not work. I am happy to adjust the code-style, if we can find a way to make this work and maintain readability. I want code in the same scope(e.g. method arguments) to be indented to the same level.
When we have a code-style that works I would love to apply it on the entire Java code code base.
